title.narrative: Improving the Resilience of Marginalized Communities in Ouham Pende Region, Central African Republic

description.narrative: The overall objective of this intervention is to improve the resilience of selected communities in Ouham Pende (Central African Republic) through a participatory approach that will gather local authorities, relevant line ministries and communities to rehabilitate community infrastructures and basic services. This project contributes to addressing the feeling of neglect among youth, a main driver of instability for communities. The project strengthens dialogue between local authorities and communities through the set-up of local committees to promote transparent and inclusive decision-making mechanisms. The project also pays particular attention to youth-at-risk of recruitment by armed groups through the renewed incomes generating activities opportunities. The approach is aligned with the integrated Government and International Community strategy based on the Humanitarian Response Plan. The project promotes gender equity throughout its implementation and the target group is unemployed youth (18-35) or/and with conflict carrying capacity of targeted communities, among whom at least 50% of are women. The project assists 2,000 direct beneficiaries and indirectly reaches 40,000 community members, who benefit from improved governance system and basic services.
